title: 25% Growth, 25% Cut Workforce Rebalancing
summary: AI transforms workforce composition, not just size—simultaneous 25% growth in some roles and 25% cuts in others, with skills half-life shrinking from 7 to 3.6 years

content.whatItIs: McKinsey CEO Bob Sternfels articulated one of the most honest frameworks for AI's workforce impact: AI has 'fundamentally changed how McKinsey staffs its business, allowing it to add and cut jobs in equal measure'—approximately 25% growth in some roles and 25% cuts in others.
howItWorks: Simultaneous 25% growth and 25% cuts across different role types
Speed imperative: 'I haven't met a CEO yet that isn't talking about how do I get my organization moving faster'
Skills half-life insight: ROI on employee skills has shrunk from ~7 years to 3.6 years over 30 years
If skill ROI is accelerating downward, traditional training approaches need fundamental rethinking
'Equal measure' approach suggests AI reshapes composition of work, requiring continuous workforce rebalancing
content.coreInsight: AI transforms workforce composition, not just size. Plan for simultaneous hiring and reduction across different role types. Recognize that skills half-lives are shortening dramatically (7 years → 3.6 years), requiring fundamental changes to training investment models.
content.keyMetrics: ~25% growth, ~25% cuts simultaneously. Skills ROI: 7 years → 3.6 years (and accelerating). CEO priority shift: less about strategy, more about organizational speed.
